page.title: 14EMPLOYMENT.
page.content: This is a problem in such a changing community. Farming no longer needs the manpower which the village supplied. With no daily transport to centres of work, the young people tend to move out of the village, their place often taken by tourists and week end people. This means the shops are no longer viable. There is now only the baker who sells a small amount of grocery, and the Post Office.Newcomers do not, on the whole support the Post Office but drive into Holt or Fakenham. Eventually this will mean the loss of its services and the older residents without cars will have difficulty in cashing pensions, or shopping within the village. A small unit, making collators in the former school,is the only local industry.
